
# False Reminder

Run the code then you will get a checker flag...put it in flag checker to get the flag

```python
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes, inverse

# Given parameters
p = 41574236054890603029103741721226840291119200460345781570909100715212140984632648662967930133433804552495337061868699032230928459603068193041075977454613787
q = 27632000603214675289458694596627939656613022938310529573840932781987410669682737330127408368779289413800873302848737517743686451316258894298254852377683637
dp = 31754299620056745286293940817239909432115504485153864047713457352356289443638806996386555360930405030505807212810495864265736696863615736745001147496003819
dq = 17753340088798088597482906653954447947281757737818964382954974390819596580074324744185342389553832786775613350672929652862251940210472149506639258267347069
message = 

# Calculate mp and mq
mp = pow(message, dp, p)
mq = pow(message, dq, q)

# Compute CRT (Chinese Remainder Theorem)
q_inv = inverse(q, p)  # q inverse modulo p
h = (q_inv * (mp - mq)) % p
m = mq + h * q

# Convert decrypted message to bytes
decrypted_message = long_to_bytes(m)
print("Decrypted message:", decrypted_message.decode())
```
